subject: RE: [junit] Need help with JUnit and Win98
msgSnippet: You have to have c: junit3.6 in your classpath. Donald Holliday ... From: Kent Johnson [mailto:kenteroo@netwiz.net] Sent: Friday, May 11, 2001 1:14 PM To:
messageBody:
You have to have c:\junit3.6 in your classpath.

Donald Holliday


-----Original Message-----
From: Kent Johnson [mailto:kenteroo@...]
Sent: Friday, May 11, 2001 1:14 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Need help with JUnit and Win98


Hi All,

I am having what I hope is a simple problem. I am trying to run JUnit on
Win98 and keep getting the dreaded:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
junit/textui/TestRunner

when I type:

java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

at the prompt no matter what directory I am in.

I have JUnit installed in C:\junit3.6

my path in AutoExec.bat is as follows:

SET
PATH=c:\Perl\bin\;C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~6\VT6\BIN;C:\jdk1.3.0_02\bin;C:\junit3.
6;C:\junit3.6\junit.jar;C:\junit3.6\junit;C:\junit3.6\junit\tests;C:\junit3.
6\junit\samples;C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~6\COMMON\MSDEV98\BIN;%PATH%

As you can see, I'm desperate. jdk1.3.0_02 is installed and working
perfectly. I installed JUnit on an NT box last week and it worked perfectly
the first time.

Many TYI,

Kent
